thread.title: War on ISIS a focus of UNGA amid stalemate
thread.title_full: War on ISIS a focus of UNGA amid stalemate | News24

author: news24.com
title: War on ISIS a focus of UNGA amid stalemate
text:
Beirut - When world leaders convene for the UN General Assembly (UNGA) this week, it will be a year since the US president declared the formation of an international coalition to "degrade and ultimately destroy" the Islamic State group (ISIS).
Despite billions of dollars spent and thousands of airstrikes, the campaign appears to have made little impact.
The extremist group may control slightly less territory than a year ago, but it continues to launch attacks and maintains key strongholds in Syria and Iraq. The militants' reach has expanded to other countries, including Libya, Egypt's Sinai Peninsula and Afghanistan.
US-led airstrikes helped Syrian Kurds hold the strategic border town of Kobani in January, and seize another key border town, Tal Abyad, this summer. But a much-touted offensive to oust ISIS militants from the Iraqi city of Ramadi remains stalled; there have been grave losses among the few Syrian rebels trained by the US to fight ISIS; an ISIS-free zone announced by Turkey and the US has failed to materialise.
